main.java.search

Class BinarySearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.search.Search
      • main.java.search.BinarySearch

  • public class BinarySearch
extends Search
    An algorithm with complexity logN which searches an ordered list by trimming the range of the upper and lower bounds.
    Author:
    Matthew E. Coupal

      • search

        public int search(int[] args,
         int element)
        Method that searches an array.
        Specified by:
        search in class Search
        Parameters:
        args - List of integers to be searched in.
        element - The item being searched for.
        Returns:
        The index of the first occurrence of the element in the list.

      • recursiveSearch

        public int recursiveSearch(int[] args,
                  int element)
        Performs the Binary Search recursively.
        Parameters:
        args - List of integers to be searched through.
        element - The integer to locate.
        Returns:
        The index of the element in the given list; -1 if not found.

      • recursiveSearch

        private int recursiveSearch(int[] args,
                  int element,
                  int min,
                  int max)
        Helper method of recursiveSearch. Performs the Binary Search recursively.
        Parameters:
        args - List of integers to be searched through.
        element - The integer to locate.
        min - The lower bound of the search.
        max - The upper bound of the search.
        Returns:
        The index of the element in the given list; -1 if not found.
